files.author: Anna V. Klepikova, Artem S. Kasianov, Evgeny S. Gerasimov, Maria D. Logacheva, Aleksey A. Penin

file.info: IN.sn, First elongated internode (from last rosette leaf to first cauline leaf). Sample was collected when first silique was yellow and ready to open.
file.name: https://s3.amazonaws.com/iplant-cdn/iplant/home/araport/rnaseq_bam/Klepikova/SRR3581899/accepted_hits.bam
file.read_map_method: All RNA-seq reads were processed through a quality check and trimming pipeline using FastQC (Andrews, 2010) and Trimmomatic (Bolger et al., 2014) respectively to remove residual adapters, low-quality sequences (the default criteria for Trimmomatic-0.32), and reads below 36 bp. Sequences from each library were aligned to the TAIR10 genome. Tophat version 2.1.1 with bowtie2 version 2.2.8 on UseGalaxy (Afgan et al., 2016) with the following custom parameters (rest remained default to UseGalaxy's settings): -i/--min-intron-length 50 -I/--max-intron-length 5000 . See Cheng, Krishnakumar et al. (2017) for more details.

file.name: https://s3.amazonaws.com/iplant-cdn/iplant/home/araport/rnaseq_bam/Klepikova/SRR3581872/accepted_hits.bam
file.read_map_method: All RNA-seq reads were processed through a quality check and trimming pipeline using FastQC (Andrews, 2010) and Trimmomatic (Bolger et al., 2014) respectively to remove residual adapters, low-quality sequences (the default criteria for Trimmomatic-0.32), and reads below 36 bp. Sequences from each library were aligned to the TAIR10 genome. Tophat version 2.1.1 with bowtie2 version 2.2.8 on UseGalaxy (Afgan et al., 2016) with the following custom parameters (rest remained default to UseGalaxy's settings): -i/--min-intron-length 50 -I/--max-intron-length 5000 . See Cheng, Krishnakumar et al. (2017) for more details.

file.info: IN, First elongated internode (from last rosette leaf to first cauline leaf). All samples are collected at the moment of the anthesis of the first flower.

file.info: F.SP.y, Sepals of young flower (at stage 9 according to Smyth et al., 1990). Sample collected at the moment of the anthesis of the first flower. All leaf samples were taken from the third leaf, if other not indicated. Samples were collected at 5 stages: 7 days after germination (young, ~ 3mm in length), 9 days after germination (intermediate 1, ~ 5 mm in length), 12 days after germination (intermediate 2, ~ 10 mm in length), at the moment of anthesis of the first flower (mature leaf) and at the stage of maturation of seeds in first siliques (senescent leaf).

Tophat version 2.1.1 with bowtie2 version 2.2.8 on UseGalaxy (Afgan et al., 2016) with the following custom parameters (rest remained default to UseGalaxy's settings): -i/--min-intron-length 50 -I/--max-intron-length 5000 . See Cheng, Krishnakumar et al. (2017) for more details.
file.description: Arabidopsis thaliana Leaf Petiole of the senescent leaf

file.info: L.lg, Whole third leaf. Sample was collected at the moment of anthesis of the first flower. All leaf samples were taken from the third leaf, if other not indicated. Samples were collected at 5 stages: 7 days after germination (young, ~ 3mm in length), 9 days after germination (intermediate 1, ~ 5 mm in length), 12 days after germination (intermediate 2, ~ 10 mm in length), at the moment of anthesis of the first flower (mature leaf) and at the stage of maturation of seeds in first siliques (senescent leaf).

Tophat version 2.1.1 with bowtie2 version 2.2.8 on UseGalaxy (Afgan et al., 2016) with the following custom parameters (rest remained default to UseGalaxy's settings): -i/--min-intron-length 50 -I/--max-intron-length 5000 . See Cheng, Krishnakumar et al. (2017) for more details.

file.info: F.SP.y, Sepals of young flower (at stage 9 according to Smyth et al., 1990). Sample collected at the moment of the anthesis of the first flower. All leaf samples were taken from the third leaf, if other not indicated. Samples were collected at 5 stages: 7 days after germination (young, ~ 3mm in length), 9 days after germination (intermediate 1, ~ 5 mm in length), 12 days after germination (intermediate 2, ~ 10 mm in length), at the moment of anthesis of the first flower (mature leaf) and at the stage of maturation of seeds in first siliques (senescent leaf).

Samples were collected at 5 stages: 7 days after germination (young, ~ 3mm in length), 9 days after germination (intermediate 1, ~ 5 mm in length), 12 days after germination (intermediate 2, ~ 10 mm in length), at the moment of anthesis of the first flower (mature leaf) and at the stage of maturation of seeds in first siliques (senescent leaf).
file.name: https://s3.amazonaws.com/iplant-cdn/iplant/home/araport/rnaseq_bam/Klepikova/SRR3581672/accepted_hits.bam
file.read_map_method: All RNA-seq reads were processed through a quality check and trimming pipeline using FastQC (Andrews, 2010) and Trimmomatic (Bolger et al., 2014) respectively to remove residual adapters, low-quality sequences (the default criteria for Trimmomatic-0.32), and reads below 36 bp. file.name: https://s3.amazonaws.com/iplant-cdn/iplant/home/araport/rnaseq_bam/Klepikova_Stress/SRR3724786/accepted_hits.bam
file.read_map_method: All RNA-seq reads were processed through a quality check and trimming pipeline using FastQC (Andrews, 2010) and Trimmomatic (Bolger et al., 2014) respectively to remove residual adapters, low-quality sequences (the default criteria for Trimmomatic-0.32), and reads below 36 bp. Sequences from each library were aligned to the TAIR10 genome. Tophat version 2.1.1 with bowtie2 version 2.2.8 on UseGalaxy (Afgan et al., 2016) with the following custom parameters (rest remained default to UseGalaxy's settings): -i/--min-intron-length 50 -I/--max-intron-length 5000 . See Cheng, Krishnakumar et al. (2017) for more details.
